cue: How to substitute whole milk and sour cream?
I don't have milk and sour cream
dialog2.response:
You can substitute whole milk with coconut milk and sour cream with Greek yogurt. Here's the adjusted recipe:

Cooking spray
6 matzo sheets
8 large eggs
1 cup coconut milk
¾ cup white sugar
½ cup Greek yogurt
2 teaspoons vanilla extract
1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
¾ teaspoon kosher salt
¼ teaspoon ground nutmeg
¼ cup chopped golden raisins
¼ cup chopped dried apricots
¼ cup chopped dried apples

Here’s the modified preparation steps for the dish:

Lightly coat a 2-quart baking dish with cooking spray. Set aside.
Break matzo sheets into bite-sized pieces. Whisk together eggs, coconut milk, sugar, Greek yogurt, vanilla, cinnamon, salt, and nutmeg in a large bowl. Stir in raisins, apricots, apples, and matzo pieces. Transfer to the prepared baking dish, smoothing into an even layer. Cover with aluminum foil and transfer to a refrigerator to chill for 8 hours, or overnight.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Remove baking dish from the refrigerator and uncover.
Bake in the preheated oven until puffed and set, 40 to 45 minutes. Remove from the oven and let sit at room temperature for at least 15 minutes.

The substitution may affect the nutritions of the dish. Here's an estimation of the changes in nutritional facts for the same dish (per serving):

Calories: Approximately 172 (from the coconut milk) + Approximately 220 (from the Greek yogurt) = Approximately 392 calories (slightly higher)
Fat: Approximately 48g (from the coconut milk) + Approximately 10g (from the Greek yogurt) = Approximately 58g (higher)
Carbohydrates: Approximately 6g (from the coconut milk) + Approximately 9g (from the Greek yogurt) = Approximately 15g (lower)
Protein: Approximately 5g (from the coconut milk) + Approximately 23g (from the Greek yogurt) = Approximately 28g (higher)
